definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to attach importance to sth/to value
China Central Television (CCTV), abbr. for 中國中央電視台|中国中央电视台[Zhong1 guo2 Zhong1 yang1 Dian4 shi4 tai2]
to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
China Central Television (CCTV), PRC state TV network

sentences.english: So it sort of depends on the industry. But yeah,
sentences.chinese: 所以視行業而決定。但同時，

sentences.english: It is a common fallacy to regard school as theonly workshop for the acquisition of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 視學校爲汲取知識的唯一場所是種常見的謬誤。

sentences.english: It is this love that knows no separation. To it, far is near.
sentences.chinese: 此愛不可分隔，視天涯如咫尺。

sentences.english: A person that does not get online, often inspect a network to be great scourges .
sentences.chinese: 一個從來不上網的人，常常視網絡爲洪水猛獸。

sentences.english: This eerie festivity is observed in America and Europe on October 31.
sentences.chinese: 美國和歐洲都視10月31日爲陰森的節慶。

sentences.english: He considered that it was caused by the non-uniformity of the apparent annual motion of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲這是由太陽週年視運動的不均勻引起的。

sentences.english: Dr Kengerli looks to Turkey as his mother country.
sentences.chinese: 肯戈理博士視土耳其爲自己的祖國。

sentences.english: Ore distributed shape was deduced by the apparent resistivity section.
sentences.chinese: 利用視電阻率切片圖來推演礦體展布形態。

sentences.english: The government neglects us here [in the neighbourhood]. It is deemed to be an illegal settlement.
sentences.chinese: 政府完全漠視我們在這裏生活，視我們爲非法移居者。

sentences.english: Apply powder liberally as often as necessary by shaking powder into your hand and smoothing onto skin.
sentences.chinese: 撲粉寬鬆視需要經常動搖粉末到你的手和平滑到皮膚。

sentences.english: The essence of the denigration of women is our definition as sex object.
sentences.chinese: 詆譭婦女的實質就是視我們爲性目標。

sentences.english: Zen master had a faithful but very naive student who regarded him as a living buddha.
sentences.chinese: 有位禪師有個很虔誠卻天真的弟子，視他爲活佛。

sentences.english: There was a time when everyone’s opinion was mine as well.
sentences.chinese: 曾有一段時間，我也視別人的意見爲我所有。

sentences.english: The energy characteristics of TVs can vary as much as picture quality.
sentences.chinese: 電視的能源特性視畫面質量的不同而各有不同。

sentences.english: Some politicians have put national interest above their own short-term popularity.
sentences.chinese: 一些政治家們視國家利益優先於其個人短期名聲。

sentences.english: But it depends on the stone.

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
